description.narrative: The most significant, expected Project-level outcome is that, at a time of unprecedented crisis as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, the proposed investment will help food flow globally and allow developing markets to maintain jobs and exports. Further, ETG will ensure the availability of liquidity for its distributors and farmers through its procurement activities. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the financing will improve market resilience by maintaining procurement of agricultural commodities across ETG's supply chains and by building the capacity of suppliers and of the Group to withstand shocks and stresses related to COVID-19.

The proposed investment consists of (i) an A Loan of up to US$30 million with a tenor of up to 3 years including one-year grace; and (ii) a B Loan of at least US$120 million with a tenor of 3 years including 1-year grace. The IFC loan will be backed by a 25% First Loss Guarantee from the Private Sector Window of the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP-PSW), to rebalance the risk-return profile of the transaction for IFC. ETG is a vertically integrated agricultural supply chain manager involved in the origination, procurement, warehousing, logistics of multiple agricultural commodities and processing of consumer products. It is active in over 26 African countries, as well as in India, China and South East Asia and has additional trading, merchandising and/or treasury desks in Europe, the Americas and the Middle East. The financing will help ETG mitigate the impacts from COVID-19 across its supply chain which have adversely impacted its operations. The proposed investment will provide much needed liquidity to support the uninterrupted production and distribution of food commodities globally during this trying period. This project is linked to ETG Term Facility - https://disclosures.ifc.org/project-detail/SII/43692/etg-term-facility
